verses.verse: Is there not an appointed<WH6635> time<WH6635> to man<WH582> on earth?<WH776> are not his days<WH3117> also like the days<WH3117> of an hireling?<WH7916>
As a servant<WH5650> earnestly desires<WH7602> the shadow,<WH6738> and as an hireling<WH7916> looks<WH6960> for the reward of his work:<WH6467>
So<WH3651> am I made to possess<WH5157> months<WH3391> of vanity,<WH7723> and wearisome<WH5999> nights<WH3915> are appointed<WH4487> to me.

When<WH4970> I lie<WH7901> down,<WH7901> I say,<WH559> When<WH4970> shall I arise,<WH6965> and the night<WH6153> be gone?<WH4059> and I am full<WH7646> of tossings<WH5076> to and fro to the dawning<WH5399> of the day.<WH5399>
My flesh<WH1320> is clothed<WH3847> with worms<WH7415> and clods<WH1487> of dust;<WH6083> my skin<WH5785> is broken,<WH7280> and become<WH3988> loathsome.<WH3988>
My days<WH3117> are swifter<WH7043> than a weaver's shuttle,<WH708> and are spent<WH3615> without<WH657> hope.<WH8615>
O remember<WH2142> that my life<WH2416> is wind:<WH7307> my eye<WH5869> shall no<WH3808> more<WH7725> see<WH7200> good.<WH2896>
The eye<WH5869> of him that has seen<WH7210> me shall see<WH7789> me no<WH3808> more: your eyes<WH5869> are on me, and I am not.
As the cloud<WH6051> is consumed<WH3615> and vanishes<WH3212> away: so<WH3651> he that goes<WH3381> down<WH3381> to the grave<WH7585> shall come<WH5927> up no<WH3808> more.
He shall return<WH7725> no<WH3808> more<WH5750> to his house,<WH1004> neither<WH3808> shall his place<WH4725> know<WH5234> him any more.<WH5750>
Therefore<WH1571> I will not refrain<WH2820> my mouth;<WH6310> I will speak<WH1696> in the anguish<WH6862> of my spirit;<WH7307> I will complain<WH7878> in the bitterness<WH4751> of my soul.<WH5315>
Am I a sea,<WH3220> or a whale,<WH8577> that you set<WH7760> a watch<WH4929> over<WH5921> me?
When<WH3588> I say,<WH559> My bed<WH6210> shall comfort<WH5162> me, my couch<WH4904> shall ease<WH5375> my complaints;<WH7879>
Then you scare<WH2865> me with dreams,<WH2472> and terrify<WH1204> me through visions:<WH2384>
So that my soul<WH5315> chooses<WH977> strangling,<WH4267> and death<WH4194> rather than my life.<WH6106>
I loathe<WH3988> it; I would not live<WH2421> always:<WH5769> let me alone;<WH2308> for my days<WH3117> are vanity.<WH1892>
What<WH4100> is man,<WH582> that you should magnify<WH1431> him? and that you should set<WH7896> your heart<WH3820> on him?
And that you should visit<WH6485> him every morning,<WH1242> and try<WH974> him every moment?<WH7281>
How<WH5704> long<WH4100> will you not depart<WH8159> from me, nor<WH3808> let me alone<WH7503> till<WH5704> I swallow<WH1104> down my spittle?<WH7536>

I have sinned;<WH2398> what<WH4100> shall I do<WH6466> to you, O you preserver<WH5341> of men?<WH120> why<WH4100> have you set<WH7760> me as a mark<WH4645> against you, so that I am a burden<WH4853> to myself?

And why<WH4100> do you not pardon<WH5375> my transgression,<WH6588> and take<WH5674> away<WH5674> my iniquity?<WH5771> for now<WH6258> shall I sleep<WH7901> in the dust;<WH6083> and you shall seek<WH7836> me in the morning,<WH7836> but I shall not be.
